meanings.definition: To remove fuel from (a vehicle or machine).
meanings.sent1: I need to defuel the car before we can work on it.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will defuel the airplane before maintenance.
meanings.sent3: Trying to defuel a car with no gas is like trying to bake a cake without flour.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to defuel the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to defuel the burning car to prevent an explosion.

meanings.definition: To deplete the fuel supply of (a vehicle or machine).
meanings.sent1: The long journey defueled the truck completely.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the engine running all night defueled the generator.
meanings.sent3: His appetite seemed to defuel the fridge in no time.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout session defueled his energy reserves.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected detour defueled the car faster than expected.
